Author: wolfgang#3508
Content: Hello all - im trying to figure out if this is the right solution for me.

Author: wolfgang#3508
Content: Is the wallet available through antara mobile friendly?

Author: wolfgang#3508
Content: Basically want a token for a competition ill be running for a local community here.

Author: wolfgang#3508
Content: Dont know if using antara and kmd would be the way to go or just use RVN?

Author: wolfgang#3508
Content: tokens earnt through the comp will be ongoing like a currency for this community

Author: Markus#5464
Content: atomicdex wallet is very user friendly yes

Author: Regnar#6164
Content:
@wolfgang what type of competition is it going to be? Also are the participants developer heavy or not really? This is to give me an idea of what is the best fit for you. Generally Antara is the simplest route and the best looking as you can get the wallet, explorers, etc with Antara. 

If your community is heavy developers they may be more interested in the nitty gritty parts of it, and you may want to explore the documentation for command line interface. However this wouldn't be a great route if you prefer everyone to be able to have their coins on mobile wallets.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: If the coins are rewards for a competition, and it isn't something like a blockchain developer competition, I would suggest Antara. That will give you the coins, the wallets, the explorers, basically everything you need to provide coins as rewards and for your community to interact with them, hodl, send them, trade, check them out on explorers, the user friendly crypto experience.

Author: Regnar#6164
Content: @ca333 is definitely the go to here for walking you through Antara and making sure it is the right fit for you and your goals if you would prefer to discuss your plans in a less public channel.

Author: ca333#0118
Content:
Feel free to contact me if you have any more questions @wolfgang - @Regnar just explained it perfectly. 
Antara lets you set up your blockchain/token, the entire minimal infrastructure to form a p2p network, blockchain explorer, SPV infrastructure, mining nodes, and much more just with a few clicks - however, it is not a pre-requirement to use Antara in order to build your chain on KMD and to get the mobile DEX wallet. Everything is pretty much very independent of each other on our platform.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content:
antara framework is the initializer. and yes komodo team indeed has built it and made it easy, for SMEs to get started with komodo tech to start their own independent blockchain with much less efforts than being a developer, it does not mean it is booted by or started by the komodo devs.
it's the system.
system is created and setup by the komodo devs.
now it's the system who takes care of all things automatically.
and since the system also gives the params to all people who wants to connect to this independent blockchain to make transactions over a fully synchronised network client, it becomes distributed, being spread over multiple nodes than just the initial nodes which started this independent blockchain at the first place.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: I guess since it's all the core basics of Network Topologies, could be confusing to non-IT people, but in a Decentralised/Distributed Network there is no central point of failure.

Author: grewalsatinder#9653
Content: Neither any central point of control.
